response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "medium", "At 21, youth can be associated with higher impulsivity, yet the factor is moderating and not extreme."],
    ["Race", "low", "Race, by itself, is not a determinant in recidivism risk and should be weighed with caution."],
    ["Prior Arrests/Convictions", "high", "Two arrests with convictions indicate a pattern that increases recidivism risk."],
    ["Physical Attributes (Height/Weight)", "low", "Height and weight are generally not linked to recidivism risk."],
    ["Marital Status", "low", "Never married and living alone offers minimal direct influence on recidivism without additional context."],
    ["Educational Attainment", "medium", "A high school diploma and no college enrollment indicate moderate risk as higher education is often a protective factor."],
    ["Employment History", "medium", "Holding three jobs in a year may indicate job instability, contributing moderately to risk."],
    ["Drug Use", "medium", "Past marijuana use within four years suggests some behavioral risk without heavy substance abuse factors."],
    ["Mental Health", "low", "Not feeling depressed in the past month suggests a relative stability in mental health."],
    ["Early Household Size", "low", "Growing up in a small household (size 3) has minimal direct predictive value."],
    ["Religious Belief", "low", "Belief in a divine influence is typically a neutral factor regarding recidivism."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 75
}

risk_factors: At 21, youth can be associated with higher impulsivity, yet the factor is moderating and not extreme.
Race, by itself, is not a determinant in recidivism risk and should be weighed with caution.
Two arrests with convictions indicate a pattern that increases recidivism risk.
Height and weight are generally not linked to recidivism risk.
Never married and living alone offers minimal direct influence on recidivism without additional context.
A high school diploma and no college enrollment indicate moderate risk as higher education is often a protective factor.
Holding three jobs in a year may indicate job instability, contributing moderately to risk.
Past marijuana use within four years suggests some behavioral risk without heavy substance abuse factors.
Not feeling depressed in the past month suggests a relative stability in mental health.
Growing up in a small household (size 3) has minimal direct predictive value.
Belief in a divine influence is typically a neutral factor regarding recidivism.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as Black. He has been arrested 2 times and has been convicted. He is 6 feet 9 inches and weighs 190 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 3 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived in a household of size 3. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
